findings.title: Token holders can double their token balances
findings.description: Token holders can exploit a vulnerability to increase their token balance by manipulating the transfer function.

findings.title: Insufficient validation of newly created oven owners
Finding 9: A compromised core administrator could steal wXTZ or deposited XTZ
findings.description: If the core administrator account were compromised, it could be used to steal all deposited XTZ.

findings.title: Finding 10: A compromised tzip-7 administrator could steal wXTZ
findings.description: If the tzip-7 contract administrator account were compromised, it could be used to steal wXTZ by burning tokens in one account and minting them in another.

findings.title: wXTZ deviates from the tzip-7 specification
findings.description: wXTZ does not conform to the tzip-7 standard.

findings.title: Possible race condition when wXTZ owns tokens
findings.description: The token contract does not check approvals when the `from` address is the contract itself, allowing users to claim all of those tokens and undermine system functionality.
